# (2020) 10 Best Earbuds with Microphone That Are Great for Calls

  * 19  minute read

(Last Updated On: April 29, 2020)

Learn what to look for in a quality pair of earbuds with great microphones.

As earbuds are small and can fit snugly inside the ear, they are perfect for
just about any situation. You can use them while working out, on your daily
commute to work, or even on a lazy day at home. Plus, earbuds with microphones
allow for easier, hands-free communication.

However, not all earbuds’ microphone (mic) is of great quality and some can be
downright crappy. The mic feature is mostly an afterthought for most
manufacturers – a _good-to-have_.

With this guide, we gather some of the best earbuds that are not just great
for music but also deliver great call quality. You will also learn:

  * How does a mic work?
  * How to differentiate between different types of mic?
  * How do multiple mics work hand-in-hand to reduce noise?

##  **1\. Jabra Elite Active 65t**

![Jabra Elite Active
65t](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%20824'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Jabra Elite Active 65t

###  **Key Features**

  * Snug and secure fit
  * 4 MEMS mic
  * Wide frequency range in mic (100 Hz to 10 kHz)
  * Wind noise protection
  * Solid connectivity with integrated Bluetooth 5.0
  * Long battery life (up to 15 hours with charging case)
  * Voice command ability

Read full review: [Jabra Elite Active 65t | Business In Front, Party In The
Back](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/06/review-jabra-elite-active-65t/)

The [Jabra Elite Active
65t](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07BHF993Q/?tag=headphonesty0420-20) true
wireless earbuds blazes the trail with its sleek design and array of features
engineered for a truly wireless experience. With an IP56-rated design and a
2-year warranty against damage from sweat and dust, it is perfect for people
with an active lifestyle.

Whether for listening to music or making calls, or even for getting your phone
to execute your voice commands, Jabra Elite Active 65t makes for a solid pair
of earbuds with mic.

###  **Multiple mics for better ANC**

The more the mics in the earbuds, the better the noise pickup and subsequent
suppression. Jabra Elite Active 65t is equipped with 4 MEMS mics, allowing for
better voice pickup and active noise canceling during calls or voice commands.
It also features an acoustic open chamber design for wind noise protection.

#### Jabra Elite Active 65t’s Mic Test

  1. [Jabra Elite Active 65T (Quiet)](https://www.headphonesty.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Jabra-Elite-Quiet.mp3)
  2. [Jabra Elite Active 65T (Noisy)](https://www.headphonesty.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Jabra-Elite-Noisy.mp3)

### **EarGels™ for a snug fit**

EarGels increase comfort and provide the secure fitting and dependable in-ear
stability needed for when you’re on the move. With three sets of EarGels
available in different sizes, you get to choose the size that best ensures
great sound quality wherever you go.

###  **Personalize your sound experience with the Jabra Sound+ app**

Download the [Jabra Sound+
app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.jabra.moments&hl=en)
from your Google Play or Apple App Store and customize the way your earbuds
transmit and receive sound to suit your surroundings. Want to enhance your
music experience, use the app’s advanced equalizer to listen to your music the
way you want to hear it. You can also modify your call settings from the app
for a more superior calling experience.

###  **Voice commands made easy**

Connect instantly to Siri®, Google Assistant™ or Alexa and get things done on
the go. Whether you need to search a new location on the map, get a traffic
update, or even have messages in your inbox read back to you, enjoy a seamless
connection from your Elite Active 65t earbuds to your smartphone with
Bluetooth 5.0.

![Man wearing his Jabra Elite Active 65t \(From:
Jabra\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201100'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Man
wearing his Jabra Elite Active 65t (From: Jabra)

###  **Drawbacks**

The Elite Active 65t isn’t the most affordable earbuds with microphone on the
market. But for the features that Jabra has packed into this true wireless
earbuds, you can say it is worth the price tag.

  * »Excellent noise isolation
  * »Truly wireless with no annoying cables to tangle
  * »In-app sound customization
  * »Integrated motion sensor

##  **2\. Hifiman TWS600**

![Hifiman TWS600 True Wireless Earbuds with secure in-ear
fit.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%20735'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Hifiman TWS600 True Wireless Earbuds with secure in-ear fit.

###  **Key Features**

  * Topology Diaphragm Technology for more natural and detailed sound quality
  * [Frequency response](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frequency_response): 20Hz to 20kHz
  * Voice command ability
  * Extra-long battery life
  * Long-range transmission distance for clear communication at 490 feet (150 meters)

Read full review: [HIfiman TWS600 | The
Terminator](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/09/review-hifiman-tws600/)

HIFIMAN stakes its claim in the True Wireless market with the [TWS600 HiFi
Earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07TR4C9L2/?tag=headphonesty0420-20).
Featuring its proprietary Topology Diaphragm driver which comes with a unique
nano-coating to manipulate the sound signature and characteristics, to achieve
specific sound outputs.

This diaphragm requires a [burn-in](https://www.headphonesty.com/2016/01/why-
you-should-or-should-not-burn-in-your-headphones/) period for the earbuds, so
it’s best to let them run for a couple of hours before evaluating its sound
performance.

### HIFIMAN TWS600’s Mic Test

  1. [HIFIMAN TWS600 (Quiet)](https://www.headphonesty.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/hifiman-tws600-quiet.mp3)
  2. [HIFIMAN TWS600 (Noisy)](https://www.headphonesty.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/hifiman-tws600-noisy.mp3)

### **Up to 490 feet (150 m) communication distance**

The mic quality of the TWS600 delivers crisp clarity even over long distances.
HIFIMAN even made a [video showcasing its long-range Bluetooth connectivity
and clear communication](https://youtu.be/m1WUtMjPaaA).

###  **Press for two seconds to wake up the voice assistant**

The TWS600 supports most voice assistants, including Siri, Cortana, Alexa, and
Google Voice Assistant. It also features a single-channel option so you can
use only one earbud for calls, listening to music and other related functions.

taekwondo world champion, Guo Ting pictured with Hifiman TWS600 earbuds  
(From: Amazon)

###  **Drawbacks**

The TWS600 loses points for the bulkiness of its charging case and an
[apparent dearth in of sub-bass
presence](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/09/review-hifiman-tws600/#earbuds-

### Pros:

  * »IPX4-rated for Resistance to Sweat & Dirt
  * »Easy controls on either earbud
  * »Good mic quality
  * »Stable Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity
  * »38.5 hours battery life (5.5 hours in earbuds and 33 hours in charging case)

## 3\. Taotronics SoundLiberty 79

![The faceplate of the SoundLiberty
79](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%20764'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Taotronics
SoundLiberty 79

### Key Features

  * Smart AI Noise Reduction Technology
  * IPX7
  * Stable Bluetooth Connection
  * Great bass
  * 40hrs playback time
  * Affordable

the [Taotronics SoundLiberty

with “Smart AI Noise Reduction” technology that is great at picking up your
voice among the background noises.

  2. [SoundLiberty 79 (Noisy)](https://www.headphonesty.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/SoundLiberty-79-Noisy.m4a)

From the demo, you can hear that the voice is being picked up and amplified.
Even in noisey environment, the voice clarity is still maintained.

### High sweatproof rating – IPX7

At IPX7, the SoundLiberty 79 is highly sweatproof. To give you a better
perspective, IPX8-rated headphones allows you to swim with it!

### Great for workout

With a great bass, stable Bluetooth connection and being sweatproof, the
SoundLiberty 79 is a triple threat as a [headphones for
workout](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/12/best-wireless-workout-
headphones/).

### **Affordable**

At less than $50, this pair of true wireless earbuds is a steal for the number

![Relatively low-

background noise. I will recommend the SoundLiberty 79 if your background
environment is not overwhelmingly noisy.

##  **4\. TaoTronics SOUNDELITE 72**

![TaoTronics SOUNDELITE 72 Wireless Earbuds \(From:
TaoTronics\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201100'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
TaoTronics SOUNDELITE 72 Wireless Earbuds (From: TaoTronics)

###  **Key Features**

  * Noise-canceling mic with cVc 8.0 technology
  * 3 EQ Settings (Normal, Bass & Treble)
  * Splash-proof earbuds with an IPX6 rating
  * Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity
  * Secure fit with different sized hooks and tips

TaoTronics specializes in reasonably priced electronics but the [SOUNDELITE 72
wireless
earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C7D95FF/?tag=headphonesty0420-20) could
stand up to other higher priced products in the same category. It features a
“better-than-CD” sound output thanks to its [aptX HD codec
](https://www.aptx.com/aptx-hd)technology, which is designed to deliver
uncompromised sound performance and exceptional clarity.

Another endearing feature of the SOUNDELITE 72 is the 3 EQ settings — normal,
bass, and treble — which let you customize your in-ear sound experience. It’s
sleek magnetic build design also lets you attach the earbuds together and
comfortably hang them around your neck when not in use.

###  **cVc 8.0 Noise Canceling Mic**

The SOUNDELITE 72 wireless earbuds come with a built-in microphone and
advanced cVc 8.0 noise cancellation technology so you can enjoy clear hands-
free calls on the go. cVc technology is responsible for suppressing background
noise and enhancing your voice clarity for the person on the other end of the
line.

###  **Microphone located closer to the mouth**

The microphone of the SOUNDELITE 72 is located along the cable connecting both
earbuds. This gives it an edge over some true wireless earbuds since it means
the mic is closer to the mouth, which in turn, allows for clearer calls.

![Woman using SOUNDELITE 72 wireless earbuds \(From:
TaoTronics\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201093'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Woman
using SOUNDELITE 72 wireless earbuds (From: TaoTronics)

### Drawbacks

There are consumers who complain about the comfort level of the SOUNDELITE 72
earbuds, especially with the ear hook section, which may feel like it’s
digging into the ear after prolonged use. However, TaoTronics has provided 2
extra ear hooks of different sizes, so it’s a matter of changing them to the
ones that feel most comfortable.

[ **Check Latest Price on
Amazon**](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C7D95FF/?tag=headphonesty0420-20)

### Pros:

  * »Built-In microphone with noise cancellation
  * »Above-average sound quality with 3 EQ settings
  * »IPX6 water protection
  * »Up to 14hr Playtime

### Cons:

  * »The design is not the most comfortable
  * »The mic sensitivity could be better

##  **5\. SOUNDPEATS Q35 HD Wireless Earbuds**

![SOUNDPEATS Q35 HD Bluetooth Earbuds \(From:
Amazon\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201100'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
SOUNDPEATS Q35 HD Bluetooth Earbuds (From: Amazon)

###  **Key Features**

  * Built-in mic with APTX HD Audio cVc Noise Cancellation
  * Stable and clear sound with 10mm driver
  * Latest Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity
  * Voice assistant enabled
  * Magnetic Charging Contactor

The [SOUNDPEATS Q35 HD Wireless
Earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VRSB391/?tag=headphonesty0420-20) packs
a punch with its powerful 10mm sound driver and high-end chipset QCC3034
designed for superior bass stereo sound with reinforced clarity. If you’re in
the market for budget earbuds, then the Q35 HD should definitely feature on
your list.

Boasting an IPX8 rating, you can immerse them in water for a long time.
However, you should note that swimming with them may not be ideal since water
interferes with Bluetooth signals. Nevertheless, they’re more than suitable
for intense workouts and making calls or listening to music under heavy
downpours.

###  **In-line Mic that is closer to the mouth**

The headset has an in-line mic allowing it to be closer to the mouth for
better call clarity. SOUNDPEATS doesn’t specify what type of mic is used, but
if the Q35 HD is anything like other models like the [Q30+ (SOUNDPEATS Force)
wireless earbuds](https://www.soundpeatsaudio.com/en/soundpeatsaudio-com-
soundpeats-force-neckband-bluetooth-
headphones.html#product.info.specifications), then it’s likely to be an ECM
mic coupled with APTX HD Audio cVc noise cancellation technology.

###  **Magnetic Charging**

The Q35 HD wireless earbuds are equipped with a magnetic contactor that
automatically connects together with the USB magnetic slot for seamless
charging. There are also magnets at the back of each earbud that clasps
together so you can safely hang them around your neck when not in use.

![Man wearing SOUNDPEATS Q35 HD Wireless Earbuds in the rain \(From:
SOUNDPEATS\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201100'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Man
wearing SOUNDPEATS Q35 HD Wireless Earbuds in the rain (From: SOUNDPEATS)

###  **Drawbacks**

While the Q35 HD wireless earbuds generally represent a good back for your
buck, they are limited by their relatively short coverage distance. Even
though it comes with the latest Bluetooth 5.0 technology, the maximum working
range only clocks in at around 33 feet(10m).

[ **Check Latest Price on
Amazon**](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VRSB391/?tag=headphonesty0420-20)

### Pros:

  * »Above-average sound quality for its price
  * »APTX HD Audio cVc noise cancellation technology
  * »IPX8 water protection rating
  * »Sleek design with magnetic charging
  * »Powerful battery life (up to 14 hours playtime)
  * »12 months hassle-free warranty

### Cons:

  * »Limited working range
  * »Call clarity could be a bit better

##  **6\. Airpods Pro**

![Apple AirPods Pro True Wireless Earbuds \(From:
Amazon\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201100'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Apple AirPods Pro True Wireless Earbuds (From: Amazon)

###  **Key Features**

  * 2 microphones in each earbud
  * Active noise cancellation for immersive sound
  * Quick access to voice assistant (Siri)
  * Adaptive EQ
  * Sweat and water resistance
  * Transparency mode for hearing and connecting with the world around you

The previous AirPods were a smashing success with their true wireless form
factor and seamless connectivity, but the [AirPods
Pro](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07ZPC9QD4/?tag=headphonesty0420-20) takes the
entire experience up a notch. For one, the [AirPods
Pro](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/10/apple-airpods-pro-7-pro-features-
that-you-should-know/) comes with a new vent system designed to equalize
pressure and minimize discomfort. They also feature a new in-ear design with
silicone tips that allow for a more snug fit.

Add the IPX4 water and sweat resistance rating and the adaptive EQ feature
designed to automatically tune music to the shape of your ear and deliver
balanced sound output whether you’re listening to hip hop, R&B, classical,
rock, pop, or podcasts.

###  **Active noise cancellation technology**

Each earbud has two microphones — the one outside detects incoming noise and
cancels it out with the anti-noise feature, while the one inside also filters
outside noise as well as analyses how your music is responding to your ear
geometry and adjusts it accordingly.

Plus, the shorter, curvy stems of the earbuds aim the microphone a bit more
squarely at the mouth for improved voice pick up and overall call quality.

###  **Transparency Mode**

AirPod Pros come with a built-in Transparency mode that you can turn on even
with Active Noise Cancellation. Essentially, this lets you enjoy your music
while still hearing the ambient environment around you.

![Woman using Airpods Pro true wireless earbuds \(From:
Amazon\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%201100'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Woman
using Airpods Pro true wireless earbuds (From: Amazon)

###  **Drawbacks**

The Apple AirPods Pro earbuds have only been on the market for a couple of
weeks and users have been quick to compare them against the [Sony
WH-1000XM3](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07G4MNFS1/?tag=headphonesty0420-20)
since they’re both in a similar price range. The most common drawbacks noted
for the AirPods Pro have been the somewhat bland sound quality for its price
and medium battery life at around 4.5 hours.

[ **Check Latest Price on
Amazon**](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VRSB391/?tag=headphonesty0420-20)

### Pros:

  * »Good active noise suppression
  * »Supports wireless charging
  * »Refined design for a comfortable and secure fit
  * »Hands-free voice assistant
  * »IPX4 water resistance
  * »Adaptive EQ

### Cons:

  * »Sound could be better for its price
  * »Battery life could be better
  * »Limited features when paired with Android devices or Windows PC

##  **7\. Powerbeats Pro True Wireless Earbuds**

![Powerbeats Pro True Wireless Earbuds \(From:
Amazon\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%20715'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Powerbeats Pro True Wireless Earbuds (From: Amazon)

###  **Key Features**

  * Dual beam-forming microphones for enhanced phone call performance
  * Balanced sound with noise isolation
  * Auto play/pause whenever you remove or put on the earbuds
  * Fast charging (5-minute charge can deliver 1hr+ playtime)
  * Reinforced design for sweat & water resistance

The [Powerbeats Pro
earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07R5QD598/?tag=headphonesty0420-20)
represent the next logical step for Apple’s series of true wireless premium
[workout earbuds](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/12/best-wireless-workout-
headphones/). Featuring Apple’s proprietary H1 Chip, these earbuds are
designed to deliver a faster and more stable wireless connection from a
distance.

In addition to providing protection against sweat and water, the Powerbeats
Pro comes with adjustable, secure-fit ear hooks to stay on even during
vigorous workouts.

###  **Hands-Free Siri**

Activate Siri on the go with a simple “Hey Siri” voice command. For non-Apple
devices, you’ll need to tap the button on the earbud to activate your voice
assistant. Still, the voice pickup is pretty good

###  **Dual**[ **beam-forming**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beamforming)

##  **How to Pick the Best Earbuds with Microphone**

![Bose QuietControl 30 Wireless Earbuds With Mic \(From: Snap
Goods\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%20758'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Bose QuietControl 30 Wireless Earbuds With Mic (From: Snap Goods)

Obviously, the quality of the mic is a determining factor in choosing the best
earbuds with microphone. So if you’re looking to get a new pair of in-ear
headphones with mic, here’s a brief breakdown of what to look for in a mic
that makes your buying worth it.

Ask yourself these **key questions** to help you make an informed choice:

  * How does a mic work?
  * What makes a good mic?
  * Do the earbuds come with noise-canceling technology in the mic?
  * Where is the mic located and how far is it away from the mouth?
  * Are the earbuds a good snug fit in your ear?

###  **How Does a Mic Work?**

A microphone works by converting [sound
waves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sound) (acoustic energy) into [audio
signals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audio_signal). This conversion process
may vary based on the type of microphone, but they all have one common feature
— [the diaphragm](https://mynewmicrophone.com/diaphragm/), a thin membrane
that vibrates in reaction to external sound waves.

![Illustration of how a microphone works \(From: Tech In
Tangent\)](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201100%20750'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Illustration
of how a microphone works  
(From: Tech In Tangent)

Without it, the microphone cannot fulfill its function as a
[transducer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transducer) — converting converts
energy from one form to another. The vibration from the diaphragm causes the
other microphone components to vibrate, which are then converted into
electrical currents that become the audio signal.

The loudspeaker at the other end of the audio chain is also a transducer —
converting the audio signal’s electrical currents back into acoustical energy,
which is the sound coming from the earbuds.

> A microphone’s diaphragm picks up sounds and converts them into electrical
> currents, similar to how we use our diagrams to sing

###  **Types of Mics Used in Earbuds**

There are two most popular technologies used for constructing the microphones
used for earbuds —

  *  **Electret Condenser Microphones (ECM)**
  *  **Micro-Electro-Mechanical System (MEMS)**.

Both operate by causing a shift in electrical properties through the
deflection of the diaphragm, which acts as a capacitor plate. The converted
energy is then amplified to deliver an audio signal which is picked up by the
host system. In the case of MEMS microphones, however, the variation is
converted and encoded.

#### Difference Between ECM and MEMS

Despite the operational similarities, ECM and MEMS technologies are actually
quite different.

  1. MEMS microphones are newer to the market and come in smaller package sizes, making them ideal for smaller devices. This feature is also what enables true wireless earbuds to have internal mics.

  1. They also feature relatively lower [output impedance](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/04/headphone-impedance-demystified/), which makes them the ideal choice in electrically noisy environments.

  1. That said, ECMs remain a practical choice since their larger sizes make it easier to facilitate design upgrades and source solutions for dust and moisture protection.

> MEMS microphones have more advantages, which is why they are used across
> several products today, such as smartphones, headphones, tablets, hearing
> aids, and cars among others.

###  **What Makes a Good Mic?**

There are a few things as frustrating as having to repeat yourself over and
over because the other person on the phone can’t hear what you. That’s why
it’s important to understand the factors that define a good mic. These
include:

####  **Voice Pickup**

This refers to the microphone’s ability to pick up voice with **appropriate
volume** and **clarity**. Some higher-end earbuds come with an integrated
voice assistant option that lets you talk to your phone’s voice-controlled
personal assistant (Siri, Cortana, or Alexa), without actually using the
phone.

The voice assistant picks up your voice when you utter a set of voice commands
and executes them without you having to touch or swipe anything on your phone.
This makes it ideal for driving, working out, cooking, and just about any
activity that requires you to work with your hands a lot.

The **frequency range** and **sensitivity** of the microphone are crucial in
determining the quality of the voice pickup. If you frequently need to “talk”
to your voice assistant during the course of your day, then you’ll want to go
for a mic that is sensitive and had a wide frequency range.

Having a very sensitive mic can have downsides because it can pick up a lot of
surrounding sound. This is where noise filtering comes in.

####  **Noise Filtering**

Having a noise-filtering mic is a definite must, especially if you need to use
it in a noisy environment. In addition to filtering out the background noise,
it should also isolate your voice, allowing the receiver to hear you clearly
without you having to talk out loud.

##### Noise filtering at the chip level

At the chip level, the type of mic in the microphone can (ECM or MEMS) help
out with noise filtering. As previously mentioned, the relatively lower output
impedance of MEMS microphones allows for better noise filtering than ECM
microphones.

##### Active Noise Cancellation Mic

Before we go any further into [Active Noise Cancellation
(ANC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_noise_control) works, you should
know this feature is usually used misleading in the product specifications.

Sometimes manufacturers will advertise their headphones as _active noise
canceling_ headphones and state that it has cVc noise-cancellation technology.
Is that true? **No.**

 **cVc is the mic’s ANC technology**. It specifically deals with the noise
coming through the mic and also the voice clarity.

Don’t confuse the ANC for mic and the ANC technology in headphones such as
[Bose
QC35](https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/headphones/over_ear_headphones/quietcomfort-35-wireless-
ii.html) and [Sony
WH-1000XM3](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07G4MNFS1/?tag=headphonesty0420-20).
Those are used to reduce noise so that they can enjoy their music in peace.

#####  **How Does ANC Work?**

ANC technology works based on the concept of [Digital Signal Processing
(DSP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_signal_processing)), which
involves analyzing and modifying real-world signals like voice, audio, and
video to optimize their efficiency. For ANC to work, the [earbuds need to have
multiple mics receiving sounds at a different
distance](https://www.jabra.com/blog/noise-cancellation-in-headsets-what-
exactly-is-it/).

The mic closest to your mouth picks up your voice while others pick up on the
surrounding noise and filter it out through DSP, leaving just your voice. This
is done through [special converters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Analog-to-
digital_converter) that take analog signals and digitizes them to produce a
higher quality signal than the original. A good example is the [Jabra Elite
Active 65t](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/06/review-jabra-elite-
active-65t/) wireless earbuds, which feature a 4-mic system for more efficient
ANC.

You can read more about [DSP here](https://www.shure.com/en-US/performance-
production/louder/the-fundamentals-of-digital-signal-processing-3).

Some examples of ANC technology include:

  * [ **Clear Voice Capture (cVc) by Qualcomm**](https://www.qualcomm.com/products/features/cvc-noise-cancellation-technology) — cVc’s technology works on the transmission and receiving path of voice calls for optimum noise suppression and voice quality across wireless communications.

  * [ **Jabra Noise Blackout™**](https://www.jabra.ca/Support/~/media/5766F0529161467E968DFC2C42E4A894.ashx) — Jabra products use their own proprietary tech to ensure a crystal clear and noise-free quality of the uplink of the audio on their wireless headsets. It leverages DSP to optimize their digital transmission systems for greater noise reduction on digitized audio signals.

####  **Position of the Mic**

This varies with the design of the earbuds. The premise here is pretty
straightforward — **the closer the distance of the mic to the mouth** , **the
clearer the voice pickup** would be and **the lesser the ambient noise** from
the environment. Some earbuds have mics that are positioned inline on the
cable, which might be too far away from the mouth and resulting in poor voice
transmission.

If you are looking for in-ear headphones with mic, chances are you’ll be

##  **FAQ**

###  **Is there a microphone on earbuds?**

There sure are! True wireless earbuds like the Jabra Elite Active 65t and the
Apple AirPods Pro even come with multiple microphones in each earbud which are
then used for calls and voice commands.

###  **How do I use my earphones as a mic?**

Microphones and earphones both operate on the principle of the vibrating
diaphragms in reaction to external soundwaves, which then convert sound into
electrical signals and back to sound again. This means you can use your
earphones as a mic. That being said, the audio quality from your earphone-
turned-mic will be nowhere near the quality if you used an actual microphone.

###  **How does the microphone on earbuds work?**

A microphone is basically a transducer — a device that converts energy into a
different form. In this case, it converts acoustic energy from your voice into
audio signals which are then transmitted to the person on the other end of the
line.

Now the loudspeaker through which that person hears your voice is also a
transducer, converting the transmitted audio signal back into acoustic energy.
This conversion happens rapidly so it just seems like you’re hearing each
other’s voices, which in fact a series of ultra-fast conversions are taking
place in real-time.

###  **How can I test my earphone mic?**

There’s different ways to test the mic on your earphones. The simplest way is
to connect it to your phone and make a call. If the other person on the end of
the line can hear you clearly, then you’re all set. You can also [test the mic
on your computer](https://www.dummies.com/computers/pcs/test-the-microphone-
on-your-windows-pc/) or use this [online mic
test](https://www.onlinemictest.com/) to confirm that your mic has been set up
properly.
